intro: Macrotis anceps, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rock heath, is a perennial shrub native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white to pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
